turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Art & Project.
turn.1: What artists were included in the Art & Project?
turn.2: Barry Flanagan, Douglas Huebler, Lawrence Weiner, Sol LeWitt, Robert Barry, Carl Andre, Joseph Kosuth, Richard Long, Andrew Lord, Stanley Brouwn, Gilbert & George, Alighiero Boetti, Francesco Clemente, Allen Ruppersberg, Marcel Broodthaers, John Baldessari, Hamish Fulton, Jan Dibbets, Ian Wilson, Bas Jan Ader, Han Schuil and Daniel Buren.
turn.3: Did any famous people purchase or own art?
turn.4: Among the gallery's clients were important art collectors in the Netherlands and Belgium such as Edy de Wilde (director Stedelijk Museum, 1963-1985), Benno Premsela, Martin and Mia Visser, Frits and Agnes Becht, Herman and Nicole Daled, and Anton and Annick Herbert.
turn.5: Did they have any other art related publications?
turn.6: Between September 1968 and November 1989 Geert van Beijeren & Adriaan van Ravesteijn published 156 bulletins of the influential art magazine "Art & Project".
turn.7: What kind of information did the publications include?
turn.8: The first magazines were merely announcements of upcoming exhibitions in the "Art & Project" gallery.
turn.9: Did they have any other uses for the bulletins?
turn.10: Later editions more and more took the form of art objects.
turn.12: "Art & Project" was meant to be a monthly magazine but was not always published regularly (17 in 1972; only 8 in 1973).
